title: vec::consume/consume_mut are probably not failsafe.

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

body:
Code looks like this:

```
fn consume<T>(+v: ~[T], f: fn(uint, +v: T)) unsafe {                                                                                                                          
    do as_imm_buf(v) |p, ln| {                                                                                                                                                
        for uint::range(0, ln) |i| {                                                                                                                                          
            let x <- *ptr::offset(p, i);                                                                                                                                      
            f(i, move x);                                                                                                                                                     
        }                                                                                                                                                                     
    }                                                                                                                                                                         

    raw::set_len(v, 0);                                                                                                                                                       
}         
```

What happens if the callback fails in the middle of the loop?
